intro: Brittonastrum breviflorum, commonly known as the short-flowered Brittonastrum, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of the southwestern United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and typical sunflower-like structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing adaptations to withstand drought and nutrient-poor soils. Its small, clustered flowers are usually pale green to yellowish in color, and it produces small, dry fruits known as achenes. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a sensitive indicator of ecosystem health.
